intro: Gilia ambigua, commonly known as the slender gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the family Polemoniaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Gilia ambigua is often found in disturbed soils and is considered an important component of native plant communities in its range.
